titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

body.p: The day was warm and fine. I wrote letters to Bunting, Walters, and Harold, and then sat out in the garden and read Marmion.
In the afternoon Charlie took us in his motor round Lochs Lomond and Long. The views were romantically beautiful.
At dinner were Admiral Dennistoun, and Mrs & Miss Russell. The last are New Zealanders who have been living in Queen Anne's Gate, and attending S. Margaret's.
